intro: Funastrum pallidum, commonly known as the pale funastrum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly found in countries like Brazil and Mexico. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are small, pale yellow, and clustered in racemes, often blooming during the rainy season. Funastrum pallidum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
